Reason: The ideal_consistency_level configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing this value can significantly impact system performance. Setting a higher consistency level can increase the latency of read and write operations as the system needs to wait for more replicas to respond, while setting a lower consistency level can lead to potential data inconsistency and conflicts. Therefore, the value of ideal_consistency_level directly affects the trade-off between consistency and performance in the system.
